intro: Sigmatostalix tenuirostris, commonly known as the narrow-beaked sigmatostalix, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its slender, woody stems and lanceolate leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers with five petals, typically in shades of white or pale pink. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release seeds, and it is often found in dry, open habitats. Due to its limited distribution and specific ecological requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
